p: In our case, the significant xanthine oxidase inhibition exercised by the RaEO may be explained by the high amount of sesquiterpene hydrocarbons contained in this essential oil. Our results are in good agreement with those obtained by Kaurinovic et al. [ 43] with the essential oil of Marrubium peregrinum L., which is rich in Î²-caryophyllene, bicyclogermacrene and germacrene D.
